subLabel.preValidation: Configure the load balancer that routes client requests to IBM WebSphere cluster.

elements.name: selectLoadBalancer
elements.label: Select a load balancer
elements.toolTip: Select 'IBM HTTP Server' or 'Azure Application Gateway' and provide the required information to configure a load balancer. If you select 'No', you will not be able to use this offer to add a load balancer later to an existing cluster. You either must set up a new cluster or add a load balancer manually.

options.text:
This option will provision an Azure Application Gateway (WAF_v2 or later SKU), a public IP, and a backend pool
consisting of the worker nodes in the cluster. Not all features of IBM HTTP Server load balancer are available when using Azure Application Gateway. Further configuration may be necessary after deployment.
For more information, see the product documentation.

This option will create a self-signed TLS/SSL certificate for gateway TLS/SSL termination. The Azure identity deploying
this feature must have one of the following two sets of Azure role-based access control roles:
  • Contributor and User Access Administrator of the current subscription.
  • Owner of the current subscription.

options.text:
When creating a new virtual network, each subnet's address prefix is calculated automatically based on the virtual
network's address prefix. When using an existing virtual network, a minimum virtual network size of /23 with a minimum
Applicatino Gateway subnet size of /24 and a minimum cluster subnet size of /29 is required.
Additionally, the Application Gateway subnet must be dedicated only for use by the Application Gateway and
the cluster subnet must have adequate available addresses for the cluster setup.

When creating a new virtual network, the subnet's address prefix is calculated automatically based on the virtual
network's address prefix. When using an existing virtual network, a minimum virtual network size of /28 and a minimum
subnet size of /29 are required. Additionally, the subnet must have adequate available addresses for the cluster setup.

Select 'Yes' and specify connection settings to configure WebSphere to connect to a pre-existing database. The database must be network accessible to the VNET and subnets that are configured in Networking.
